unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked about the India vs. Pakistan cricket match stats, huh? Well, last I checked, in ODIs, India's got a pretty good lead with something like 80 wins compared to Pakistan's around 55. And if you look at the World Cup matches, India's record is like, 7-0 or something crazy. Proper domination, yaar! But hey, anything can happen on the day, as they say.
normalised: Okay, so someone asked about the India versus Pakistan cricket match statistics, huh? Well, last I checked, in O-D-Is, India's got a pretty good lead with something like eighty wins compared to Pakistan's around fifty five. And if you look at the World Cup matches, India's record is like, seven zero or something crazy. Proper domination, yaar! But hey, anything can happen on the day, as they say.

unnormalised: T20s are a bit closer, I think. Pakistan might have a slight edge overall, winning maybe 9 or 10 out of around 20-odd matches played? But the important thing is, India usually pulls it off in the big tournaments. Asia Cups and World Cups – that’s where it matters. Remember that Virat Kohli innings from the T20 WC last year? Chased down 160. Magical!

unnormalised: Anyways, you can always check ESPNcricinfo or something for the exact numbers. My memory isn’t perfect, but the general trend is that India usually gets the job done in the crucial games. But honestly, who cares about the exact stats as long as we win, right? Bring on the next match!
